pullRequest.body:
---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:

```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

@dupuisf just so you're aware, I not only fixed the lemma names, but I also added a few new lemmas too.

I'm open to putting `ContinuousOn.ofReal_map_toReal` elsewhere if you want, but it is pretty specialized.

:v: j-loreaux can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10646374595/job/29513137286)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10646374595/job/29513137543)

Just a few last comments, but otherwise LGTM.

bors d+

Just a few last comments, but otherwise LGTM.

bors d+

```suggestion
lemma norm_le_iff_le_algebraMap (a : A) {r : ℝ} (hr : 0 ≤ r) (ha : 0 ≤ a := by cfc_tac) :
    ‖a‖ ≤ r ↔ a ≤ algebraMap ℝ A r := by
```
I feel like `algebraMap` should feature in the lemma name somehow (and likewise below).

```suggestion
lemma norm_le_natCast_iff_of_nonneg (a : A) (n : ℕ) (ha : 0 ≤ a := by cfc_tac) :
    ‖a‖ ≤ n ↔ a ≤ n := by
```
This is technically not `ofNat` but rather `natCast`, and it doesn't work with numeric literals. As far as I can tell, to actually make this work with numeric literals, we have to do something like
```lean
lemma norm_le_ofNat_iff_of_nonneg' (a : A) (n : ℕ) [n.AtLeastTwo] (ha : 0 ≤ a := by cfc_tac) :
    ‖a‖ ≤ (no_index OfNat.ofNat n) ↔ a ≤ (no_index OfNat.ofNat n) := by
  simpa using norm_le_iff_of_nonneg a n.cast_nonneg
```
and then the lemma only works for `n ≥ 2` as advertised. I don't know how to avoid special-casing 0 and 1.
I don't think we need the `ofNat` version, I just messed up the naming when I added these.
Shouldn't we swap the names of those two?
Again, the names should be swapped

```suggestion
lemma nnnorm_le_natCast_iff_of_nonneg (a : A) (n : ℕ) (ha : 0 ≤ a := by cfc_tac) :
    ‖a‖ ≤ n ↔ a ≤ n := by
  simpa using nnnorm_le_iff_of_nonneg a n
```
Also this is still about `norm` and not `nnnorm`.
`#find_home` says `Topology.Instances.NNReal` which seems pretty reasonable.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: in a unital C⋆-algebra, `‖a‖ ≤ r ↔ a ≤ r • 1`, and related lemmas
